page.title: 2001 in the People's Republic of China

revisions.rev:
{{Year in the People's Republic of China|2001}} Events in the year '''[[2001]] in the [[People's Republic of China]]'''.
== Incumbents == * [[President of the People's Republic of China|President]] â [[Jiang Zemin]] * [[Premier of the People's Republic of China|Premier]] â [[Zhu Rongji]]
==Events== [[File:Putin and Jiang Zemin document-signing ceremony 2001.jpg|thumb|right|220px|[[Jiang Zemin]] and [[Vladimir Putin]] after signing the [[2001 Sino-Russian Treaty of Friendship|Treaty of Good-Neighborliness and Friendly Cooperation]]]]
===January=== * January 9 â [[Shenzhou 2]], an unmanned Chinese spacecraft, was launched.
===April=== * April 1 â [[Hainan Island incident]]: a [[mid-air collision]] between an [[EP-3E]] [[United States Navy]] spyplane and a [[People's Liberation Army Navy]] [[People's Liberation Army]] [[Shenyang J-8|J-8II]] [[interceptor aircraft|interceptor]] fighter jet 70 miles (110 km) away from the PRC-controlled island of [[Hainan]]. The collision caused the death of a PRC pilot, while the EP-3 was forced to make an unauthorized [[emergency landing]] at Lingshui airfield. The incident results in an [[international incident|international dispute]] between the United States and the [[People's Republic of China]]. * April 11 â [[Hainan Island incident]]: The detained crew of a United States [[EP-3E]] aircraft that landed in [[Hainan]], People's Republic of China, after a collision with an [[Shenyang J-8|F-8]] fighter, is released.
===July=== * July 13 â The [[International Olympic Committee]] awards the [[2008 Summer Olympics]] to [[Beijing]] ([[People's Republic of China]]). * July 16 â The [[People's Republic of China]] and the [[Russia|Russian Federation]] sign the [[2001 Sino-Russian Treaty of Friendship|Treaty of Good-Neighborliness and Friendly Cooperation]].
===December=== * December 27 â The People's Republic of China is granted permanent normal trade status with the United States.
==Births== * July 8 - [[Yang Peiyi]], singer
==Deaths==
